shut up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: used to tell someone to stop talking
shut up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Oh, shut up! I don’t want to hear your excuses.
Shut up about your stupid dog, okay!
shut up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to stop talking or be quiet, or to make someone do this
shut up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I can’t stand that woman. She never shuts up.
I only said that to shut her up.
I wish you’d shut up about Chris.
shut up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to keep someone in a place away from other people, and prevent them from leaving
shut up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Was there any need to keep us shut up here?
I’ve had a terrible cold and been shut up in my room for a week.
shut up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to close a shop, room etc so that people cannot get into it
shut up.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Bernadette cleaned the attic and then shut it up for another year.
shut up.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to close a business or stop working, at the end of the day or permanently
